intro: Knautia subscaposa var. typica, commonly known as the alpine knautia, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple ray florets and a central disc of yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine meadows and rocky slopes, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its basal leaves are lanceolate and hairy, while the stems are often glandular and slightly hairy. Knautia subscaposa var. typica is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
